title: Google\Cloud\Retail\V2\Rule
name: Rule
description:
A rule is a condition-action pair

  • A condition defines when a rule is to be triggered.

  • An action specifies what occurs on that trigger. Currently rules only work for [controls][google.cloud.retail.v2.Control] with [SOLUTION_TYPE_SEARCH][google.cloud.retail.v2.SolutionType.SOLUTION_TYPE_SEARCH].

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.retail.v2.Rule

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.redirect_action
params.description: Redirects a shopper to a specific page.

params.name: data.oneway_synonyms_action
params.description: Treats specific term as a synonym with a group of terms. Group of terms will not be treated as synonyms with the specific term.

params.name: data.do_not_associate_action
params.description: Prevents term from being associated with other terms.

params.name: data.ignore_action
params.description: Ignores specific terms from query during search.

params.name: data.twoway_synonyms_action
params.description: Treats a set of terms as synonyms of one another.

params.name: data.condition
params.description: Required. The condition that triggers the rule. If the condition is empty, the rule will always apply.
